summary: Encapsulates macOS hostname management using the scutil utility, handling the three macOS name types (ComputerName, HostName, LocalHostName). It sanitizes input by converting spaces to dashes and stripping special characters to match the system’s naming rules, and provides mechanisms to read, modify, and persist both temporary and permanent hostname values.
business_intent: Enable automated, platform‑specific configuration of a Mac’s network and user‑visible identifiers, ensuring that hostnames conform to macOS conventions and are consistently applied across command‑line, Bonjour, and GUI contexts for deployment, provisioning, or system administration workflows.
